text.text_translated:
I worked five days every week.  
Then I came back from my family leave.  
I wanted more time with my children before they start school.  
My boss let me work three days every week.  
Now I work three days every week.  
I get a big cut in my pay.  
I am paid in a pro-rata way.  
My work does not go down at all.  
I do five days of work in three days.  
I get paid much less for it.  

pro-rata: you get paid only for the days you work.

best_attempt.text_translated:
I worked a typical five-day week.  
Then I came back from parental leave (time off for parents).  
I wanted more time with my children before school started.  
I talked to my boss.  
We agreed to a three-day work week.  
This meant a significant cut in my pay.  
I got pay on a pro-rata basis (only for days I worked).  
My work did not go down.  
I did five days of work in three days.  
This was not fair.
